page.title: 12MEMORIES OF AN OLD RESIDENT
page.content: {Memories of an Old Resident} Overton has changed a lot in my lifetime. There used to be a few hundred people living here when I was young (now 4,000 and rising). School used to start at 9.00 a.m. and finish at 4.00 p.m. Some people had to walk miles to school wearing stout leather boots. We had five weeks off in the summer, one week at Christmas, one week at Easter and one week at Whitsun. In July there was a sheep fair. I remember fields covered in mushrooms every year during the Autumn. Now I am old I am looked after very well by the community of Overton. There's a luncheon club and an over sixties group.
